availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Hamner (Tuscaloosa, AL, farmer + pvt 1st Ky. L. A.)

body.p: Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, farmer and soldier. Alabama native. Married to Martha B. Hamner. Father of Martha J. Hamner, John R. Hamner, and James Hamner. Student in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, in 1850. Farmer in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from June 25, 1863, to January 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Alabama, Tuscaloosa County, District 2, p. 213B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Alabama, Tuscaloosa County, Hassell, p. 257B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0149.
